data.title: Scan & OCR
data.description: Convert scans or images of documents into searchable, editable PDF files, and adjust the quality of the resulting file

data.title: Reduce File Size & Optimize
data.description: Reduce large files and optimize your PDFs without compromising quality for sharing, posting, or archiving

data.title: Create Fillable Forms
data.description: Turn a document created in InDesign, Microsoft Word, or Excel into a fillable PDF form

data.description: Learn how to permanently remove private or sensitive information from your PDF

data.description: Learn how Experience Cloud applications, application services, and Experience Platform fit into an enterprise marketing architecture.

data.title: Introduction to AEM Forms
data.description: Use this AEM 6.5 guide to create, manage, publish, and update digital forms. Find help on installing, upgrading, and configuring them, and learn about authoring adaptive forms.

data.title: Encrypting and Decrypting PDF Documents
data.description: Use the Encryption service to encrypt and decrypt documents. The Encryption service tasks include encrypting a PDF document with a password, encrypting a PDF document with a certificate, removing password-based encryption from a PDF document, removing certificate-based encryption from a PDF document, unlocking the PDF document so that other service operations can be performed, and determining the encryption type of a secured PDF document.

data.title: Understand the different types of PDF forms and documents
data.description: PDF is actually a family of file formats, and this article describes the types of PDFs that are important and relevant for form developers.

data.title: AEM Forms tutorials and videos
data.description: Browse our videos and tutorials for AEM Forms, with resources and documentation to answer your queries.

data.title: Adobe Experience Platform Overview
data.description: Adobe Experience Platform enables organizations to centralize and standardize customer data before applying data science and machine learning to dramatically improve the design and delivery of rich, personalized experiences.

data.title: Adobe Experience Platform Debugger Extension
data.description: Experience Platform Debugger examines your web pages and helps you find problems with how your Experience Cloud solutions are implemented.

data.title: Basics of Schema Composition
data.description: Learn about Experience Data Model (XDM) schemas and the building blocks, principles, and best practices for composing schemas in Adobe Experience Platform.

data.title: XDM System Overview
data.description: Standardization and interoperability are key concepts behind Adobe Experience Platform. Experience Data Model (XDM), driven by Adobe, is an effort to standardize customer experience data and define schemas for customer experience management.

data.title: Adobe GenStudio User Guide
data.description: Explore the capabilities of Adobe GenStudio for Performance Marketing. Learn how to quickly create on-brand assets, generate variations, and optimize experiences.

data.title: What is Target?
data.description: Learn the basics of Adobe Target Standard and Adobe Target Premium. Target Premium includes advanced features not available in standard product.

data.title: Analytics Tools Guide
data.description: Product documentation and self-help for Analysis Workspace, Analytics dashboards (mobile app), Activity Map, Report Builder, Reporting API, and Reports & Analytics.

data.title: Adobe Analytics Documentation
data.description: Search for self-help articles and tutorials on Adobe Analytics. Learn strategies and best practices from experts in live and on-demand video events.

data.title: Adobe Analytics overview
data.description: General overview information about Adobe Analytics, including information about the Analytics interface as well as getting started information for administrators, analysts, users, and developers.

data.title: Getting Started with AEM Headless - Content Services
data.description: An end-to-end tutorial illustrating how to build-out and expose content using AEM Headless.

data.title: Developer console
data.product: Experience Manager,Experience Manager as a Cloud Service
data.description: AEM as a Cloud Service provides a Developer Console for each environment that exposes various details of the running AEM service that are helpful in debugging.

data.title: Universal Editor Introduction
data.product: Experience Manager,Experience Manager as a Cloud Service
data.description: Learn how the Universal Editor enables what-you-see-is-what-you-get (WYSIWYG) editing of any headless and headful experience. Understand how it can help content authors deliver exceptional experiences, increase their content velocity, and how provides a state-of-the-art developer experience.

data.title: System requirements
data.description: Use this reference to identify required software dependencies that have been tested with Adobe Commerce releases.

data.title: Adobe Workfront Documentation
data.description: Explore a range of Adobe Workfront documentation and learn how to manage the entire lifecycle of work in one place. Use these tutorials, guides, videos, and find support.

data.title: Adobe Workfront documentation
data.description: Documentation for Adobe Workfront.

data.title: Introduction to Adobe Experience Manager as a Cloud Service
data.product: Experience Manager,Experience Manager as a Cloud Service
data.description: Learn how Experience Manager as a Cloud Service works and what the software can do for you.

data.title: Content Modeling for WYSIWYG Authoring with Edge Delivery Services Projects
data.product: Experience Manager,Experience Manager as a Cloud Service
data.description: Learn how content modeling works for WYSIWYG Authoring with Edge Delivery Services projects and how to model your own content.

data.title: Manage SSL Certificates
data.description: Learn how to use Cloud Manager to check the status of your SSL certificates and how to edit, replace, update, and delete them.

data.title: How Does Target Work?
data.description: Learn how Adobe Target works, including information about JavaScript libraries (AEP Web SDK at.js), Adobe data centers, SEO testing, and bots.

data.title: How Do I Implement Target?
data.description: Understand basic concepts, be familiar with how Target works and integrates with your infrastructure, and understand how visitors are tracked.

data.title: What Is an Auto-Target Activity?
data.description: Learn how an Auto-Target activity in Target serves the most tailored experience to each visitor based on customer profiles and the behavior of similar visitors.

data.title: How Do I Implement Target for Client-Side Web
data.description: Learn how to implement Adobe Target for client-side web using the Adobe Experience Platform Web SDK (AEP Web SDK) or the at.js JavaScript library.

data.title: What Are Enterprise User Permissions and How Do I Use Them?
data.description: Learn how to create separate workspaces (product profiles) and then assign users different roles and permissions for individual pages, properties, or web sites.

data.title: How does at.js Manage Flicker?
data.description: Learn how at.js and Target prevent flicker (default content momentarily displays before being replaced by activity content) during page or app load.

data.title: How to Implement Target
data.description: This video walks Adobe Target developers and architects through Target implementation. Watch this video to learn the different Target implementation technologies and employ Target implementation best practices.

data.title: How Do I Use the Visual Experience Composer (VEC)?
data.description: Learn the basics of using the Visual Experience Composer (VEC) in Adobe Target. The VEC is a WYSIWYG editor that lets you easily create personalized experiences.

data.title: AEM Desktop App
data.description: Use AEM Desktop App to simplify access to any asset managed in AEM on desktop, for any application and file format.

data.title: Configure Your Firewall's Allowlist
data.description: If your firewall or mail server is configured to allow access to only certain vendors, you must add certain IP addresses to its allowlist. This opens communication between your environment and the Adobe Workfront servers and allows your users to send messages from Workfront and to use SSO with Active Directory or LDAP.

data.title: Metrics in Analysis Workspace
data.description: There are two ways to use metrics in Analysis Workspace.

data.title: Configuration guide overview
data.description: Learn about all the configurable features and services for your Adobe Commerce application.

data.title: Performance Optimization
data.description: Learn how to configure certain aspects of AEM to optimize performance.

data.title: Trigger campaigns using APIs
data.description: Learn how to trigger campaigns using Journey Optimizer APIs

data.title: Adobe Campaign Web product documentation
data.description: Campaign Web help center

data.title: Interactive data collection
data.description: Learn how the Adobe Experience Platform Edge Network Server API performs interactive data collection.

data.title: Get started with Adobe GenStudio for Performance Marketing
data.description: Learn how to get started with GenStudio for Performance Marketing to generate new brand-aligned marketing content.

data.title: What Is an Experience Targeting (XT) Activity?
data.description: Learn how to use Experience Targeting (XT) activities in Adobe Target to deliver content to a specific audience based on a set of marketer-defined rules and criteria.
